Prevention: Maintain a safe distance from others (at least 1 metre), even if they don’t appear to be sick.
Diagnosis: A viral test tells you if you are infected with SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, using samples that come from your nose or mouth. There are two types of viral tests: rapid tests and laboratory tests.

Diagnosis: Rapid Point-of-Care tests, test performed or interpreted by someone other than the individual being tested, can be performed in minutes and can include antigen and some NAATs.

FAQ: What is an N95 filtering facepiece respirator (FFR)?
FAQ Answers: An N95 FFR is a type of respirator which removes particles from the air that are breathed through it. These respirators filter out at least 95% of very small (0.3 micron) particles. N95 FFRs are capable of filtering out all types of particles, including bacteria and viruses.

Medication(general): Ensure cleaning of surfaces in the room that are touched often (tabletops, doorknobs, handles, etc.) with 1% hypochlorite solution.
FAQ: Am I still considered “fully vaccinated” if I don’t get a booster?
FAQ Answers: Yes, the definition of fully vaccinated has not changed and does not include a booster.
